intro: Anisophyllea borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean anisophyllea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with alternating leaflets. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their potential therapeutic properties. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
